title: GDC 2022
description: I spoke at GDC 2022 with Chris Burgess on "Hand Tracking: How can lessons from LBE can help at home gaming?". We then wrote the talk up into a blogpost post-event.
imageAlt: Two men pointing at a talk title on a digital screen.

title: p5.js Explorations
description: I messed around with generative art and p5.js. I mainly focused on exploiting flow fields and perlin noise.
imageAlt: Pinky red curves slowly are drawn on a screen.

title: Amazeing Escape
description: Made during an internal game jam at ultraleap. A top down stealth puzzler, focused on showing off far field interactions.
imageAlt: A right hand with a ray coming from it. The right hand pinches to place a marker in a maze, which a yellow sphere moves towards. Behind the sphere, a cube with a hat on it patrols the maze, its field of view visualised on the floor.

title: XR Launcher
description: I helped build an xr launcher (windows & xr2 headsets). This was built to prove that hand tracking is as viable as controllers for day to day tasks.
imageAlt: A left hand turns over to reveal a button on its palm. A right hand presses the button to make a UI panel appear.

title: Blocks
description: I helped rebuild blocks - a hand tracking physics playground which shows off the power of simple interactions, combined with Ultraleap's interaction engine.
imageAlt: Hands knocking over a pile of cubes

title: XR Keyboard
description:
I built and wrote about an open source, reusable, physical xr keyboard made to be used with ultraleap hand tracking and easy for novice users to get started with.

It has been described as "the best keyboard i've tried in vr with hand tracking".
imageAlt: Low poly hands in VR typing Hello World on a keyboard

title: Touchfree
description: I spent a year researching how to build great touch-less experiences for out of home kiosks. This research helped form the basis of ultraleap's touchfree application & tooling.
imageAlt: A pointed hand moving towards a screen

title: ALD Direct
description: I spent a year working at ALD Automotive on ALD Direct - a series of car leasing websites.  I maintained and iterated upon car leasing websites for a number of household names, utilising .NET & Angular technologies. I also helped design, maintain and iterate upon their selenium automated testing.
imageAlt: A pointed hand moving towards a screen

title: 3D Procedurally Generated Nature Scene
description: Made for my final year dissertation. A nature scene made with procedural generation algorithms (DiamondSquare, and L-Systems).

title: Pip Writes Stuff/ Itching For More
description: I ran an alt-games & poetry blog from 2014 to 2017, posting twice weekly. I featured small, relatively unknown games found on itch.io, as well as interviewing their creators. My writing was featured twice in Rock Paper Shotgun's "Sunday Papers"
imageAlt: A screenshot of a blog on medium

title: TRASHZINE
description: I contributed to TRASHZINE, a zine focused on interviewing small game creators.

title: Three JS Adventure Scene
description: 3D Scene made in ThreeJS for a Computer Graphics And Games module. Features a tree made with a space colonisation algorithm.

title: The Search For A Good Book
description: A low poly animation made in Blender, for an Applied Graphics module.

title: QRTTNBPBYTROAYALID
description: Quick, Run to The Next Battery Pack Before Your Torch Runs Out and You Are Left In Darkness!, (or QRTTNBPBYTROAYALID), is an infinite runner created by myself and Poppy Lomax for Ludum Dare #39 - a game jam run over three days. Poppy worked on the art and platform design, whilst I worked on the code, Unity gubbins and game feel.
imageAlt: A pixel art infinite runner, set in a cave

title: Buccaneer
description: A remake of the board game Buccaneer in Java, made for a Group Project module. I acted as lead architect, and ensured that the backend of the project interacted nicely with the UI.

title: Rare Cover Letter
description: Rare Cover Letter is an interactive cover letter I made in a few days in order to apply to Rare's Industrial Placement. They specified that they wanted something creative, instead of a normal cover letter - so I made this.
imageAlt: A pixel art image of a man walking through a city

title: Space Invaders
description: This was the first Unity project I finished! I made a Space Invaders clone (with a small twist) as a way to become more familiar with Unity and its features. Sound effects were provided by xeno_
imageAlt: A screenshot of a space invaders clone
